Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	And so begins the vocabulary of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my sons, I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, in order to fulfill its purpose and for its explanations and for its declarations, it seems to me that I have completed what I promised you in this treatise, which is part of surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The operation of the umbilical cord has been completely forgotten in our region and in our time, until recently when the science of it was rediscovered, and its evidence is now established; and no one knows about it except some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which were lost and led to errors and uncertainties until the understanding of it was established and its length was extended and its art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I see that I should arrange this treatise in the second way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and because it comes with the forms of the tools of cautery and of the other instruments of the work, which is necessary for addition to the declaration, and for preparation of it, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	In ancient times, the reason why an artist was not considered skilled in their own body was because the art of medicine is long, and it is necessary to be exercised in the science of anatomy, which was rediscovered by Galen before he knew the joints of the members and the forms of those, and the conjunction and separation of them; and also the knowledge of bones, nerves, and cartilages, and their number, and their hardness; and of pulsating veins, quiet veins, and the locations of their emission.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for that reason, Hippocrates said that a name is not important, but in the work, it is more important in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	Because we have already mentioned that one in the introduction of this book; for those who do not know what we have said about anatomy, they are not exempt from falling into error by which many men die, as I have seen too many of those, because also they are formed in this science and get their knowledge from that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	When a doctor saw a woman who had suddenly developed an abscess called an aneurysm in her neck, and it had pierced some of the neck's arteries, causing a large amount of blood to flow into her, she died between their hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And another doctor saw that the thorn of a man who had died was stuck in his state, and the thorn was large, and he came to him and tried to remove that thorn with a hook, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And he had already tried to remove it, and saw that because of the size of the thorn and the position of the patient, he knew that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And another doctor took the wages of a duke from our land for surgery, and went to a skilled blacksmith who was needed for his fracture in the patient's body; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he tried to remove the fracture, above the wound, with pillows and crutches with strong structure, and did not leave the wound open.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then remove the dressing according to his wishes, and remove the bandage, and remove the lint for several days and command that we remove the bandage; and at this time, if the wound and the foot are infected, it will reach a critical point.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And then I was called to him, and I prepared to remove the bandage, and I achieved peace and eased his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, the corruption was already confirmed in the limb, so it could not be restrained from that one, and it did not cease to spread the corruption in the limb until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who pierced an abscess and it became ulcerated after several days, until the wound became infected with a great deal of pus.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of this is that the wound is purged of melancholic humor, so it does not reach the bone at all, but rather the limb that suffers from it should be kept still.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for that, children, it is necessary for you to understand that the operation should be divided into two parts: one in the operation that is associated with immediate safety, and another in the work that is performed in the best positions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already experienced that in all places of this book where the operation is performed in which there is error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard against that and lay down that, so that the fools do not approach to speak to you and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your weapons in diligence and protection of God, and your patients in facility and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God to lead them to salvation and praiseworthy succession, and lay aside the terrible diseases of difficult healing, and keep your weapons from that which makes you afraid, so that your position in your faith and in your name does not escape you: because more remains for your glory, and more after to the world and later to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	In some of his books, he discusses:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	He does not discuss the treatment of bad patients, because they do not remember what they have been told.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already devised this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	This is the beginning of the division of the book, and the first of the first section.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is ordered according to the entrance of the foot, in the forms of instruments and in the handles of cautery, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second section.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on drying and puncturing, and on windbags, and on ulcers, and on the extraction of similar objects, all chapters and ordered according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third section.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of twisting and similar objects; chapter ordered according to the entrance of the foot, and in the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of pointed cautery and sharp medicine and remembering of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that, begins the treatise of all the free.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	That you know the quality of those handles and of the tools of that cautery, and in what condition it is prohibited to use the cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, the speech about the quality of the handle and of the tool of that cautery is a long and prolix, and subtle for knowledge, and secretly hidden; and from there to speak much of secrets, and of them they have differed, and I will leave a little of their speeches, fearing prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore, it is said that cautery corresponds to all the universal composition, which is matter or its matter, except for two conditions, which are conditions of tail-like matters.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the condition of tail and dry matter, they disagree; because one said that cautery is suitable for that, and the others said the contrary of that, that cautery is not convenient in illness which is by quality and by dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that sickness be tail-like and dry matter that is burned and dry is healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And tell that one who says the opposite of that, which is said to be very useful in all kinds of back and dry pain that is seen in the bodies of men, because when you compare the bodies of men with the moisture of them to the appearance of fire, it often harms the bodies of men.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the word of that one, who has experimented with this in some cases discovered.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But may not come over that one who has already been trained and practiced in the capital of cautery by later practice, and knows the diversity of the appearance of men and the disposition of their diseases, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the span of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other appearances, do not fear you, and more in the diseases that are wet and humid, because all the doctors have agreed on those, and they do not disagree in the usefulness of cautery in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and its goodness, is above cautery in medicine, because fire is simple, the action of which only reaches the member that is cauterized and not the other member attached to it without a small harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	May the act of medicine has brought them to that in the members which is from there, and it often brings pain to the sick member and often causes difficulty in healing.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	May the fire, for its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not do that but rather exceeds it. And we know this through experimentation and the length of service in the study of the art over the truth of the causes; and because of this, you are excused from the length of the sermon. If not for the fact that it is not read aloud in this place to you secretly by fire, and the quality of the operation of it in the bodies and its expulsion by which it expels evils, the philosophical demonstration speech would be sharpened in your eyes.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disregard the time in which it is appropriate to make a cauterization and pause at the best time of primeval.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cauterization is appropriate at all times, because the harm caused by time is submerged in the benefit of which the cauterization is thrown, and more so if the cauterization is for pain or necessary painful ones, quickly and forcefully, the ones that do not suffer delay because of the fear of those who come from evil, which is greater than small harm entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And do not catheterize in your feet, oh sons, that is only estimated by the common people and foolish doctors, because that malady which is cured by cauterization is not always effective, and they stop that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not always as they think for that, because cauterization is only a remedy in a place of medicine which alters the appearance and dries out the moisture which is the cause of the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But rather use cauterization excessively over medicine for the sake of its value and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his malady returns at some time of the day, according to the appearance of the patient and the location of his malady, and its virtue, and that which is prepared in the body of him from the aggregation of superfluities in him, and that which is obtained to him in his acquisition in foods and similar causes; but the malady in which cauterization is administered is a subtle malady in a member of few superfluities and moisture, such as a toothache for pain and similar causes, it is possible that in it does not return that pain, but that which is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And in common speech, it is believed that the pointed cautery is the best remedy in medicine, and in correct speech, I do not know what they mean by that, because they believe that there is no cure that can be achieved through medicine or any other cause that does not involve a pointed cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and they understand that the pointed cautery is the best remedy in medicine is only when administering methods of treatment in some diseases, and those medicines do not work, and at the end of the cause, they administer it, and it is effective for that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here they believe that the pointed cautery is the best remedy in medicine, not as they understand it, which I understand from the common people and too many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that gold is better than iron for a pointed cautery, and they did not say so only because of the equality of gold and the superiority of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location of the pointed cautery does not matter, since it is not absolutely true, because I have already seen that there are some people who can do it in one way and others who cannot, and a pointed cautery made of gold is better and more effective than one made of iron, but however when you make a pointed cautery with fire and gold, it is not your responsibility, since it depends on the quantity that you want to use for the roughness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive the heat; and if you adjust it over the fire, the gold melts in the fire, and some layers are made by the craftsman for that purpose.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for that, a pointed cautery made of iron is used, slightly and more directly to the straightness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter in the second chapter of the cautery, and I have ordered those between the feet, so that they ask for what they want from him.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for pain in the head due to coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery gives to the moisture and coldness over the main cause of which are the two causes that cause so much damage, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the hands and the temples fluent, and many sleep, and pain in the teeth and the gums, and generally of all evil that comes from coldness, such as paralysis, sudden and apoplexy, and similarities in those evils.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first command the patient to take a laxative medicine to clean the head, for three or four nights, according to the virtue of the patient and his age and his custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command the one who shaves his head to do so with a razor, and then make that person sit on a chair leaning over the bed and place their hands on their chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place your thumb on the blade of the razor near the humps of his nose.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the location you mentioned does not reach, then mark that location with a tent, and then apply the cautery made of olive oil of which this is the shape:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that over the location as best as possible with a tent, and then apply the cautery gently, making sure it does not touch the skin too much, and you rotate that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then slightly lift your hand and look at the location, and if you see that some part of the head is uncovered, like the amount of gra of errors, then lift your hand, and if it does not return, place your hand on that or another of those, if it is cold, enter that which I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it on that spot and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your hand over the burned area and leave it there until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the wound with quadrifarmacon oil until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that when the plague is present, the more honey is applied, the better and more beneficial it is.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they say that it should be cauterized in the groove of the bone into the bone, and held there until some part of the bone is attached.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove that which has been attached to the bone, and then treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cauterizer should reach the back, until it becomes strong in the bone before the bone breaks, and this is the way to make a small alphaca:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimate that from that spot the vapors of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And keep the wound open for a long time, and then cure it before it becomes solidified.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cauteries in any other people, except for some who use them as a second method out of fear; and if you must do so, it is better to let the wound heal by solution of continuity, as we have demonstrated in other members, especially when the head of the patient is naturally free.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cautery is safer and better for me; and from that, you should also choose the one that brings more benefit to health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter two.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the head cautery.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the head there is chronic and long-lasting pain, and that is prolonged in the patient, and he uses garlic, onions, capipurges, ointments, balls, cadels, wax, and similar things, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that has not been removed or improved from those causes, then consider that if the head of the patient is naturally strong; and not free and often great damage, then that cauterizer should use another cautery instead of that one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And if it is necessary to cauterize that on the surface of the head, use a pointed cautery through where the skin is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the skin and discover the bone as much as we have found, and cauterize that with a cautery in the part behind the head in the place called the carotid artery, — and that is the place where the bandage is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And let your hand be still, and do not discover the bone, because the patient will suffer great pain different from all other scalp cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will say that this cautery is in this place, because it covers the cautery that cauterizes the corners of the head and the back of the head is more subtle cauterization than that which is cauterized at the middle of the head; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Third.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the ancient non-antiphlogistic cauterization.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is pain in the part of the head that is sharp, or pain that extends into the ear, remove the medicines that make the head better, and administer another cure, which I have mentioned in the chapters on diseases; and if this does not help, then cauterization in that place is done in two ways: either cauterization with a sharp-burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May the pointed cautery be used as you take a lancet and prick that area and apply burning ointment to its extremities, and bind it with bandages.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then incise the location of the pain in the temple with a blade that is inserted into that location and hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then apply pressure to the stopped bleeding by constriction, and leave it for three hours; then remove the lancet and treat the wound for two or three days, and then place a poultice over the location where the bleeding occurs.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then heal that which is found when it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do that with some burning ointments which I have written about in the other treatise on burning ointments.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cauterization be done in this way: ignite a pointed cautery of the following form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a clover-shaped cautery, with the head of which is like a clover flower in which there is some curvature, and at the middle of it is a small point.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place your hand over the location of the pain, and move your hand slowly to prevent the joint from becoming stiff - which is what has been left behind.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of blood that has been stuck due to the nature of the wound is such that it can cause death, then raise your hand to prevent the artery from becoming stuck - which is what has been left behind, so that there is no bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak the wound in salted water and place it on the location, and leave it for three days; and then apply a poultice made of ground mustard, and then heal with an ointment as soon as it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cauterize the end of the knife according to the cautery, and avoid injury to the artery in this area - which is not uncommon.
Capitol quart.	Chapter fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cauterizing an ancient wound.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an old wound with the cure we have mentioned in the previous chapter, and with the cure we have mentioned in the divisions of illnesses, and if you do not apply the cure, and if the illness does not provide the medicine or the cauterizing iron, then you should ignite the knife within the location of the pain, along a long line that is the thickness of the one we have mentioned - or which one; and place your hand with a steady and strong motion as you incise the joint and reach into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuation of the mandible, which is marred by mastication, and that the jaw not be adhered and the nerve that causes it, and that it does not become spasms.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the guard and care of the flow of sanctum from the artery that is abscised, which in the abscission of it is fear, and more so for those who do not know what it is and are not studious and do not spread; and leave the operation in its beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will come to remember the regimen of the flow of sanctum accident from the artery according to its own method, in its own place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this disease that does not abate with this cautery and bears the body of the patient tolerably, cauterize that in the middle loc of the head where we have reported, and cure the plague before it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you see, administer the cautery that we have said in the chapter of strangulation of the artery having two points, and this is the best cauterization and more consistent.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the use of cautery for the pain of gout.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the big toe is caused by cold humors and is cured with laxatives or other treatments mentioned in the division, and the pain does not disappear, then use heat, and this is the method without puncturing, of which the following is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then apply the heat near the big toe, and move it around the entire foot as if it were rotating, or in the circuit of each one if the pain is in each one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Slowly move the heat along the edge of the big toe, as gently as possible to avoid damaging the area.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the heat does not touch all of the big toe, and it does not improve, then cure the affected areas as soon as possible.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the use of cautery for torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture that is cured and cannot be healed except with the special methods mentioned in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the specific area due to dryness or spasm of the nerves.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that area of torture with jerks and capnipurges and guarguarismes, and do not compare your treatment, then it is advisable to cauterize the patient with three cautery points: the first at the edge of the earlobe, the second a little below the temple, and the third at the conjunction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery in the opposite direction of the affected area, as softening only occurs in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The form of cauterization is that you cauterize that area with the cautery in the direction of the edge of the earlobe, a little higher than a small one above the corner of the cap, and in the temple another, the length of which should be second to the length of the said dot, and place your hand with the cautery until the quantity of the majority of the specific part of the codena is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the pointed cautery, which is particularly for the butcher, the form of which is given in the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But it is more subtle than that, which has a few parts with handles; and it is recommended to sharpen the knife on its excessive grease.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that place with that procedure until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of the cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and is treated with the method we have mentioned and the patient does not have fever, then cauterize that part with four cautery: on all the corners of his head; and with the cautery and the middle part of the head, as we have mentioned; and with the cautery in the back.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of the cautery is made according to what is mentioned above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is more posterior; and then care for that place with that procedure.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of the cautery for forgetfulness caused by a blow.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	That large and round tablets should be given to the patient at the beginning, which are said to be strengthening.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then remove the entire cap from the patient and place it on the wound described in the treatise of plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And place some charcoal, which is the material of the cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this second, as previously mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if those wounds are healing well; and if not, then make three more cautery marks on the back part of his head, which should be placed from the part of the head closest to the neck to the part farthest from the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the largest of the said charcoal between each cautery, and then care for the cautery as it proceeds.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you add more and the patient can tolerate it, then make the cautery in the middle; and if you add more, then cauterize that one on the two toes.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Approach the wound that needs to be healed; and use the cautery according to the shape given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of the cauterization of the perineum and the softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	That you proceed as we have said in the softening of the head and that jaws and that which we have mentioned; and then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize that cautery at the middle of the head, and cauterize all the bones of the head, and cauterize on the back part of it, and three cautery on the spine of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the illness of softening of the body of three of those and the patients tolerating and the illness is strong, then cauterize that cautery with four cautery on the spine of the back, and afterwards cauterize into that which is commorit of the neck of it, and raise the chest muscle.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then approach the wound that needs to be healed, and this cautery is olive oil.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	An epileptic is not cauterized, but that epilepsy is due to fluxion.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore you should modify his brain at the beginning of the disease with the other cure which we have said in the division when the patient is large and tolerant of the excess of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not suffer the medicines, then administer gargarisms and masterful substances, giving that for several days, good nutrition of foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then remove the patient's hair, and then cauterize that with a cauterizer at the middle of his head according to the previous method, and with another cauterizer in the back of his head, and over each ear of his head cauterize.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize that with the cauterizers which I have said, having paralysis and softening of the body over the spines of the neck and the spines of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And use an olive-oil cautery according to what is prescribed.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	If the patient is a child, then use a thin cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted and flaccid moisture, then cauterize those with the cautery that we have said in the one who has paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive and tends towards melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give him to drink that which purifies his brain according to that which has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the head of the patient, and make a small incision in a decent manner on his scalp, and then place that in the middle of his head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be lying down, and held from all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then place a liniment; and it is more suitable for an ancient sheep's bladder.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that over the fire in a measured way, the one that the sufferer says is enough when it's on them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And approach that to the middle of their head at the circle, and lay it on them until it is dissolved.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that for the patient every week until they are healed; or if you want, make small points on them according to the most of them, but always hold your hand with a cautery ordered: this is a special cauterizer that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And place that bandage in a soft way on the wound or in gray of linen.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of the application of water descending from the head.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared to you the beginning of water in the head by the symptoms that I have said in the division, then begin and give to the patient that water which melts the head of them, and keep that from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let that servant bathe the affected area in warm water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command that person to shave their head, and cauterize the pointed cautery in the middle of their head; and then cauterize it with two cautery points on two temples if it is the beginning of a headache, or with one point if it is the beginning of a headache in one temple.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Then incise the pointed cautery across all veins and tendons that are located below the skull; and place the cautery points in that longitudinal line on the level of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flow when it is cauterized; and if you see any blood flow from there, stop the pointed cautery with some medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you will find knowledge that is in the extraction of tendons and from their abscesses, and caution about blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes cautery is applied to the neck below two bones with two cautery points previously produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cautery of ancient tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the ancient tears of the bones are very manifest and flow through the veins and arteries that are in the location of the head and it is verified that such a thing is superfluous and flexible, then cauterize that pointed cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter on the beginning of water coming out of the bones, and the pointed cautery at the middle of the head and two pointed cauteries on both temples, and two pointed cauteries on the neck behind two vertebrae.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if it is necessary to add, then cauterize that in all the length of the bone of the bone over the top of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the cautery of bad smell from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar. Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.

E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of the mirror.

De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of toothache cautery.

De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On the Cautery of the Dislocation of the Shoulder
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moisture accumulates in the joints and causes pain in that part of the shoulder, and when it is stretched over the other when compared to each other.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is at the bottom of the shoulder.

De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cautery of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel. De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of cauterization for fractures.

And remember that the food given to the patient should be according to the length of their treatment, and that the intestine should not come out due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And after 40 days, if you want to remove it, then give it a decent amount of food for another 40 days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And if they are exhausted from labor and repletion of food and drink, and from intense vomiting, then they will be completely healed by this regimen of treatment.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will describe the treatment of ruptures in other parts of the abdomen, and its beginning, and so that they do not heal quickly, then cauterize the rupture with a red-hot iron according to the amount of it, and that which is extracted from the coda should be mixed with the clean part of it; and cure that which we have said, and it should not be adjusted.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And it has been said that the first treatment of the rupture should be done with a triangular cautery according to this form, rather than with a needle.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And a line is placed that is on the side closest to the rupture, and another line above; and your hand should be placed with a nail cautery, but the first cautery is more slender and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	Of cauterization of twisting.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When the limbs are injured by impact or by persistent pain that lasts for a long time and does not improve with medical treatment, then it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the pointed cautery for each member should be according to its size, power, and skill of the one using it, and location of the twist and pain in it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	If it is healed by the first pointed cautery, then it is well; but if not, then repeat the pointed cautery on it; for according to custom of those pains, they are points of the member that approach the one that is affected, so that you can obtain those pointed cauteries within that patient before he is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	Of the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Some leprous people are sometimes cauterized with a pointed cautery for great benefit, and if the type of leprosy that is caused by putrefaction of phlegm and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And therefore when you want to cauterize that one, consider if the leprosy is common and as has been said in the division and not given, and do not do it, and fear over the patient that corruption comprehends all of his body and all of his complexion, then cauterize that one on the head: with one in the middle of the head, and with the second point behind it, turning the front to the end of the hair; and with others on two ears; and with one behind, on the back or neck.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally, your hand should hold the cautery a little inside the bone, and then displace the scars, so that the exhalation of thick vapors is relieved from there; and cauterize on the melon according to what is prescribed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the patient and is clearly visible, then you should cauterize those parts with the cautery that we have mentioned in the head; and cauterize on the tip of the nose, and two cautery on both ears, and two cauteries on two spinal bones of the neck, and two cauteries on the spinal bones of the back, and one large cauterization near the collarbone, and one on the shoulder, and two on the elbows, and one on each elbow, and two on the knees, and one on each knee, and two on the calves, and two on the muscles, and two on the tendons of his chest; and cauterize that part over all the joints of those mentioned in the legs and feet, and over each toe of his feet, and on the soles of his feet.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful of the nerves that are on top of the ankle, do not burn those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	Some wounds are cauterized with a cautery on the bones of the hip and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the throat.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more you adjust the cautery, the more beneficial and more confident it is; and know that the patient does not feel pain in the cautery, as with its others, so that the body of the patient is already stupefied.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And know that the cautery should be large or small according to the members and joints according to what is preceded by the tools of the species.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then care for the cautery with flour mixed with honey and the other remedy until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de stupor.	Of cauterization of stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a member is numb or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and is not healed, then you should cauterize that numb member with a cautery according to the size of the member or its location.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And insert a small amount of the pointed cautery into the skin of the neck.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that wound until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes the veins are cauterized at certain points that cause pain in the hands and feet, and in the spine of the back and the eye sockets of the eyes, which move that member, and the wound is reopened.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	Do not presume about that, but rather know what is written in the anatomy of the member and the exit of all the nerves that move the body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	Of the cauterization of warts that are malignant.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When warts are old and do not respond to any of the medicinal ointments, then you cauterize with a pointed cautery in a small amount according to the thickness of the skin of the neck until the whiteness and color of the wart is restored, and its color is changed.

And then care for that wound with a poultice of errors and lentils with rose oil and leaves of arnica, and with honey of columbine or honey of yarrow, each part being mixed separately, and then apply a cloth and place it over the area until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter 1.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the Cauterization of the Cranium
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When a tumor begins to appear and one wishes to remove it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery along its circumference as it is rolled up.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And it is said that it should be cauterized with the back cautery in the middle place; however, I have not seen this, as I fear it may cause an ulcer, and I have already seen some such cases.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	It is better to cauterize it along its circumference with a circular cautery as we have said, or with a pointed cautery.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 10.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On the Cauterization of Adipose Tissue
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some adipose tissue is delayed in maturation, and this happens due to excess or because of the patient's old age, weakness, or time, and you wish to hasten its maturation; then cauterize it along its circumference with a small pointed cautery, and afterwards apply a poultice to that place to hasten its maturation.

Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	Of the application of a caustic.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	A corrosive is a corrupting agent that moves in the body, which corrodes whatever it touches as if with fire, like dry wood being consumed by flames.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see that corrosive in the location where the pointed cautery has been applied, then place small and large nails according to what is appropriate in that location where the corrosive is present.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then apply a pointed cautery to all parts until you have removed all the corrosion and there is no cause left of it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then let it rest for three days, and place oil mixed with turpentine on the cauterized locations until all the scabs have been removed and all the corruption has been eliminated.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then care for that animal that is giving birth.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	If three days have passed and the flesh has not given birth in a place where there is no corruption, then it is good; but if not, then repeatedly apply the cautery to that which is found in the corrupted places.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And some acute medicines are rubbed on it, which is halfway between a cautery and medicine.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	However, the cautery of fire is more useful for burning pus.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already told the cure of that animal with acute medicine in the division, and therefore take that which will be needed from it.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 44.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	Of the cauterization of warts and similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Warts that are found on the parts of the foot that cause great pain and are called warts, which make the foot lame; and they are cauterized in two ways, either by fire or by a pointed cautery.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	However, the cautery of fire is that you ignite the pointed cautery in a shape similar to a pen knife, which should be made of iron according to the quantity that contains the wart of the whole part, and should be of sharp edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then place that hot iron on the joint, and rotate your hand with the cautery around the joint until the cautery reaches the depth of the joint.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And let it stay for three days until it starts to move.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply that poultice made from wild marjoram leaves mixed with salt, and let it stay on that area for a while until that swelling is eliminated from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then clean the wound with fresh meat juice until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and there are wounds on the surface of the body, especially in the thighs and feet, then you should administer in those cauteries with water, and take a needle made of iron or brass or wood, and place that needle over the joint; and then gently pull out a few drops of blood from the needle into the margin of the skin at the joint, and hold your hand, and rotate that compression of your hand from all sides, and press the edge of the needle into the skin at the joint, and find the water flowing to the end of the joint; and wait for the patient for a short while until the bite of the water reaches the end of the joint, and then remove that, because the joint will be healed from its roots.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And then they would make points on all parts of their body that are in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then they would take care of those wounds where the roots of the thorns have been removed by those things that the flesh has absorbed.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter 45.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	Of cauterization of trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When someone has a tremble because of a nerve injury, or because of fever, or for another similar cause, it is customarily said that you should cauterize those four points or more on the spines of the back, between each spine, place one cauterizer; and on their chest, and over their stomach, place an olive tree.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of that person ceases and the healing of the sick person is fastened.

Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body there are abscesses with pus that are made of thick, rotten materials; then at the beginning, as it appears, it should be cauterized over all the wound opening with a thin, long, sharp cautery, the end of which is extended to the fire; or with the long, sharp, curved cautery.

Capitol lvi.	Chapter 66.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of cauterization of fluxes of sanct accident by incision of arceeria.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Women who have fluxes of arceeria that are incised due to the infection, or due to the incision of abscesses or cauterization of the member, and similarly, and it is difficult to remain there.
