E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a closed canula like this with a cane, and the cannula of the instrument should be a capipurge and flat, open; to which you hold the handle at the back of it, which you use when you insert into the oil or that liquid you want from the sucs and the causes suctiblas.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And this capipurge is precious: recipe of beaver, white bay leaf, ginger, salt of safra, long pepper, escafragia, and spice ana unc. as if you make from the juice of blood and of caul, and those parts are made into pillulas, and one pillula is dissolved in water, and it is poured into the nostrils of the patient facing upwards.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	About the nails on the outer parts of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	When the wounds are open in the external parts of the nose, and they are magnified and filled with other days inside when it is necessary to close them properly.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	For that purpose, you should insert it at the beginning of the appearance of the wound, and suture all of it.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then place your hand or cauterizing instrument over the area where the burning medicine is located.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	If the insertion is delayed until it is magnified, then consider if it is callous, hard, blackish color and little pain, do not touch that which is apostema crancos; for those wounds open in the area where this apostema has been inserted, they are caused by great malice on that one who had it.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the apostema is of yellowish color and not blackish, and insertion is possible in all of it, then evacuate the patient and insert that which is appropriate, and cure the area with what dries and contracts until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of sutures of the nose and lips and earlobe when continuity is dissolved by injury or similar.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	You should know that when the continuity of one of these cartilages is dissolved, you should not perform surgery on it in this way with other men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when someone has any cause of these injuries, you should consider if it is a fresh wound or not, and then adjust the two lips of the wound with sutures, and care for that wound until it heals.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of continuity dissolution are already separated, and each is made healthy, then you should excoriate each part of their visible skin until it heals.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips with sutures and strengthen those, and over them sprinkle healing powder of dragon's blood and three-thistle, and place on the powder a disc of diachylon o of any other consolidating plaster, and leave that for two or three days, and then remove it and replace it with another plaster and care for that until the wounds have healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	May the surgeon add the solution of continuity or use needles as recommended in the belly suture, or add the solution of continuity with a thread as you have done and make it known.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come in the inner thighs in the parts divided.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Some boils are found in the inner thighs of men in the divided parts of their thighs, similar to hard cysts, and some are smaller and some are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, you should turn the thighs and cut each of those hard parts, and then fill the abscess with hemostatic substance until it is strengthened, and then wash it with warm water and treat the area with what has stoptic properties until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of the beginning of flesh adjusted in the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Many boils are found on the adjusted flesh on the gums, which the ancients called albulus, so you should suspend that one or the one you have with forceps and insert it into its place, and leave the sinus to run or the wound.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then place your hand on the affected area, or apply other strengthening or stimulating powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	If that flesh returns, then secondarily incise it and cauterize it, so that the cautery will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of the reason for iron teeth.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When in the surface of the teeth of the jawbones and of the front teeth and between the gums, sharp, rough, and sometimes wavy grooves are blackened, and some yellow or green spots appear within which that corruption passes through and the teeth become loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And therefore you should scrape the patient between their teeth and place your head on their chest, and remove those teeth in which such grooves and causes similar to sand appear within which no cause has ever been found, and that is how blackness and yellowness and other colors are formed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	If that is the case at the beginning of the reasoning, then it is good; otherwise, you should repeat the reasoning on those teeth on the following day and the second and the third until it reaches the final statement in which you wish.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth require various shaped razors and different figures according to what is prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And so that you know which razors are used to shave the part of the tooth that is not visible and other razors used to shave between the teeth in different shapes, and these shapes of razors should be prepared by you as follows:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of tooth extraction.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	That you cure the tooth from all pain and delay in its entire extraction, because there is no cause that exceeds the length of the tooth when it is extracted, because the substance sublimates within which the extraction occurs.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	May it be that when the patient is prepared to have the tooth extracted, that you must be certain which tooth is causing pain, because sometimes the pain deceives the patient and they believe it is in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one and the pain does not cease until the bad and painful tooth is extracted, because we have already seen this through the operation of the wisdom teeth.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, when you must determine which tooth is causing the pain, and what you know about it, first scrape around the edge of the tooth where there might be some benefit, until it is dissolved from the tooth gum entirely, and then apply that to the tissues mentioned, or to fine forceps at the beginning gradually until that concaves.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then apply a large log in the strong jaws for good speech or extraction, and place the patient's head between your legs that you hold so that it does not move, and then try to extract the tooth straightly in a way that does not give more pain to the patient or cause him greater harm.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And therefore, if it is not forgotten, then take one of those instruments, and place it next to the tooth entirely to facilitate and reduce the effort of its removal as it is done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is broken or worn, then make sure to wrap that fracture and strengthen it with a thin wire so that it does not break during your construction on that tooth.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you should work carefully with exquisite incisions around the entire part of the gum and guard your strength so that you do not tear it away from there, and return over the patient for the main cause of their first pain.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And guard yourself from doing what ignorant barbers do in their practice and audacity regarding the eradication of them, which they do not administer as we have recommended; for these practices bring great harm to people, which are more difficult than a quadruple amputation, and all of their reasons remain unchanged, or some of those, or that they extract from that with ignorant barbers have testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And the eradication of it should be washed with water or with vinegar and salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if there is an outflow of pus, as they often do, then cut off some amount of zigy and sprinkle it on the wound, and if you do not confirm that zigy, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of forceps and holding them subtly with those that are praised for their sharpness at the beginning of a long extraction, brief and thick, so that they would not bend when performing those tasks.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And there are times when a thick handle is used until they are not bent, and the extraction tools are short.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they make extraction tools from Indian iron with straight edges, and in those extraction tools, there are teeth that interlock each other and strengthen the construction greatly, and sometimes the shape of a beak of a ciconia, which is strong.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the removal of teeth and the extraction of bones from the jaws that are wedged in.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you have to remove a tooth that is wedged in for some reason, then place your hand over the location where the jaw bone is located for one day or two until that location is softened; and then insert algestic or use extraction tools with teeth that are shaped like the beak of a ciconia or guanta, the form of forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	Their outer parts were cut off with a knife or scissors.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if they do not obey you and follow your command to hold these forceps or to hold them, then you should cover their eyes and remove all the flesh and insert the instrument called the atal, which is a small hook with this shape:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And if it has a short thick end, make it small, and do not make it too thick so that it is not triangular.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore, if the eye is not found, it is good; and if not, help yourself with these other instruments of which these are the shapes: the shape of the first instrument is a triangular exterior that has some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it be triangular and have a more subtle end.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And you have already helped yourself with this instrument having two prongs of which this is the appropriate form following:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And you will need other instruments that I will describe for the removal of teeth; because it is important to make this instrument which is shaped like an ice pick, and this is the shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	From the triangular distal part that is too short or curved, which has some swelling, and is not thinly covered so as not to be three-sided.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And other wise men say that the tools for teeth are similar to the others.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	May the artisans be wise and skilled in this art, but they must know that according to what it means for them, there are different operations and various diseases; among these are the diseases for which the ancients did not say or use a proper instrument, because of their diverse forms.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	May it be three-sided the bone of the mandible or of the other bones of the mouth, or if it is cracked, then carefully cover it with what is convenient for the tools and the forceps that we have mentioned in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and help you with how to do this:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And if there is some swelling little by little, then string it or hold it in the mouth so that it does not escape or leak until the bone is completely drained; and then restore the place with appropriate medicines for this.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is a small pustule on the bone, then prick that pustule and its surrounding black area, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	About the treatment of the most prominent teeth among others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent and not in their natural position among others, especially when they lean towards the lips or towards the most venerable women; therefore, you should consider: if a tooth is not close to another tooth, and it cannot be extracted with a hook or a lever, then you should extract that tooth; but if it is not connected to another tooth, then you should insert an instrument of this shape into it, which is similar to a pig's tusk, and it should be made of Indian iron with a sharp edge.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And if your insertion into that tooth takes several days due to the hardness of the tooth and it is not connected to another tooth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if a prominent tooth is exposed to the gum, then you should file that tooth with an iron file of this shape.
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it should be all of iron from India and the mallet; and it should be made of soft points like lima, which are made into needles, and the tooth should be sharpened a little at a time in several days for convenience, so that no other tooth is damaged or broken.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then apply lines to that area and scrape it with a razor.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if there is a tooth where a part is drilled and the tongue, then you should scrape that area so that the roughness of that fragment is stopped and smoothed, and it is filled completely so that the tongue does not descend or the word is not corrupted.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	About the restoration of damaged teeth with gold or silver.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When accidents happen to teeth before concussion and removal by percussion or impact, and the patient cannot bear that which hurts, and you have treated it with hemostatic medicines, and your treatment has not been effective, then for this reason do not use silver in those that are strong, because silver turns green and soon becomes poor, but gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And if the needle is too thin and rough according to the amount that can enter between the teeth; and the form of the thread is that you take the needle and take double of it between two healthy teeth, and approach that it increases am two crookedness of the needle between two rotten, or if one or more, until the skin reaches the healthy tooth of the other part.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And approach the sewing into the part where you started, and strengthen your hand with skill and knowledge until it is not rotten.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And your stitch should be the one that strengthens the needle of the teeth that do not escape.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And approach the excess of the needle on the outside with forceps or tweezers, and add those in each place with gesture, and convert them into those and hide them between the healthy tooth and the rotten one, so that it does not cause damage to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And approach that which is written with Roman letters.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	If it is torn or broken, strengthen that one or those with another needle in such a way that it is always whole.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of healthy teeth and the figure of straight teeth, as follows:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it is done that one or two teeth return to their respective places in the mouth and are recrowned as we have recommended, and remain so.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	This is not done by anyone but skilled craftsmen and wise ones.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	Sometimes certain cow bone fragments are used for the cause of teeth, and they are made into the shape of a tooth, and placed in the place where the tooth is missing, and strengthened as we have said, and remain and serve well for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	About the beginning of the ligament that goes into the tongue and prevents speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament that goes from the tongue to some fragments of bone or is natural to the man who was born with it, or an accidental and accidental one that has been consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation in this is that the surgeon opens the mouth of the patient, his own head being present; and he raises the tongue, and then inserts that ligament nerve according to the latitude by which the tongue is released from its recency.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	If there is any hardness or resistance in that area, and it is due to the consolidation of plague, then you should use a lancet and cut through that layer until the skin is pierced and the resistance is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful not to make a hole in the surface of the meat and that you cut here through armor and that blood flows from the wound.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then wash the footprints of the incision with warm water or vinegar or warm water; and place your hand over the tongue to prevent it from falling back into the throat, as this could cause another obstruction.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	If there is bleeding from the wound, place your hand over the vein; if the blood flows out, then cauterize the area with a pointed cautery that suits this situation.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the other cures for the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	On the extraction of a ranula from the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes, the tongue is swollen and resembles a small ball that prevents the tongue from performing its natural operation; and if it is not treated soon, it becomes very large and fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	The operation for this is to open the patient's mouth from the side and examine the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	If you see that it is black or dark and the patient does not feel pain in that area, then do not touch that part.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	If it is white and there is moisture in that area, then you should insert a thin probe into it and pierce it from all sides; if the abscess bursts during your operation, then you should place a cloth over it, which is called a sponge, until it is restricted.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work until you have completed it, and wash it with clean water and salt; and care for the other treatment according to this one until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of extraction of abscesses from the breasts and that which is not in the groin and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When an abscess occurs in the groin, they are glands that are similar to fat, which are deformed and are called breasts, which when you cure them with what we have said in the division and is not healed, then you consider whether the abscess is hard, of dark color, and little pain, then do not touch it with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of dark color and the root is large, then do not touch it with iron because of the risk of infection; instead let that be matured inside, and then either you will puncture it or it will burst by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, sharp, and the root of it is thin, then that should be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation in it is that you consider, giving your operation, whether the abscess of it has healed completely or if it has decreased in some way; and then seize the patient by the sun, and the head of it should be on your shoulder, and cover the mouth of it, and the servant takes between his hands the tongue of it from below and the instrument is a noble one of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	If it is made of silver or aram, and it is thin like a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Then when you press that silver or aram against the tongue and it shows you the abscess, and cut over that layer, then take an onion and place it in the wound, and pull it apart as much as possible.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing that you pull from the membranes, and then incise it with this instrument of which this is the shape:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is similar to forceps, but the outer parts of it are curved, so that the opening of each of those is at the end of the other, so that they are sharp, which should be made of iron and well-sharpened.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if that instrument is not at your disposal, then incise it with this tool of which this is the shape of it: And it should be sharp on one side, not sharp on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And since you have incised one wound, incise the other according to this method of incision, and then guard the patient from getting wet with water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If the patient has diarrhea, give them a decoction of senna leaves or walnut husks and similar to those that cause stool retention, and restrict the flow of stool, then cure it within that time.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes, in the same ulcer, other abscesses or those two boils occur again, and insert them according to what I said at the beginning of two melons equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And you have already treated a woman with an abscess that was not in her ulcer, the abscess tending to a dark color, with little pain, which had already closed her ulcer, and the woman was breathing straight meat, and had been prohibited from eating and drinking water, and had already reached death if more days passed.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had become so large that it had pushed two ribs apart through two openings.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore, you should make an incision in one of its ribs, and remove that, and then insert a large portion of it, and then you should incise the part where you understand the other opening, and then cover the mouth of it, and press its tongue, and then incise the rib in that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then approach him with a large piece of cloth, not from him but a few drops of blood.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore, the absolute method for that woman is to immediately start pouring water, and then apply pressure to the abscess, not stopping to incise it for a long time, and the next abscess will appear in its place, which should be incised as soon as it appears.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then apply an antiseptic and cauterize the wound, and then do this; and then approach him and do not clean what God has done to that area.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of incising an abscess when it forms.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the catarrh enters the abscess and it is long, then it is not called perpendicular; and if it is in the thick and round part, then it is called a bubble.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	When it is cured with the same thing that we have said in the division, and do not compare your cure, and sometimes the abscess is still there and is subtle, then cover that which is added round; and if it is at a certain length, and is bloody, of black color or dark, and not at the center, then cover the incision of it, because in that place there is fear over the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see the second bone that I have mentioned of its whiteness and length, make the patient lie down and take their tongue with an instrument that will shape it and place the bone in the new one, and pull that one down and insert it into one of two instruments that are called tweezers at the beginning of a pair.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And be careful not to insert it further than what is naturally adjusted, because if you insert it too much, you will damage their speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And then use the instrument that we have recommended at the beginning of a pair, and heal it while it is still healthy.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by the sight of the instrument, be careful not to use it, and use the cauterizer's head in their mouth, and take some of the water that we have mentioned in the chapter on cauterization, and hold it close to the patient's mouth, and pour it into the concavity of the instrument that has this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	The patient's external opening of the cavity in which the medicine is placed with the cavity of a spoon, and place the instrument of the medicine on the wound, and the patient turns their head to the side to prevent saliva or mucus from the mouth of that person from entering into the wound due to the intrinsic medicine, so that no cause remains on the wound of that person.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	Then place your hand with the medicine on the uvula for the space of about an hour until that wound is denigrated and soothed by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a small piece of cloth and wrap that over the end of the spoon, and submerge the cloth in the medicine, and insert the spoon with the cloth into a small canula through which the cloth adheres to that canula, and do this as many times until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the wound, and leave it there for three days or four.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if it is necessary to repeat the medication, repeat that medication and then perform cauterization by wiping around the small wound in the border of the bedding, and modify that which is within the circle of the medication, and wash it with cold water, and cure it from further inflammation with an embrocation, and give gargling remedies until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	This type of treatment is safer than the beginning and longer than fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some wounds are cured with that which is more subtle than cauterization and the beginning, which is cured with subfumigation in this manner: take camphor, hyssop, origanum, rue, scicados Arabic, camomile, broyda and similar to those of the herbs, and adjust all those causes or some of them in a bowl, and they should be submerged in very hot water and boiled; and the bowl should be well washed with decent water, and there should be a trough above the bowl where an instrument made of aram according to this method is placed; it should be made of silver or aram.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And if the patient's tongue is in the middle of their mouth, before the steam reaches the uvula over the uvulae, before the uvula becomes blurred.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And if it is necessary to repeat this cure while it is dry, and keep in mind that you should not perform this cure at the onset of abscesses, because it would make the abscess worse, and do not do this, but rather declare the diagnosis of the abscess carefully.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument present, then take a cane and place a piece of charcoal in the patient's mouth, because the charcoal prevents the steam from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of the extraction of thorns and of what sticks to the wound and other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Things stick to the wound or thorn of a foot or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then remove that which is visible from those, above which the cat's eye is placed, rather than using an instrument to lift the tongue, so that it can be declared what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And that which is not visible and is hidden in the throat, make the patient vomit so that the food can be degraded in the stomach, because often the cause of the throat ailment is removed by vomiting; or the patient swallows a piece of bread, a cracker, or a piece of dry bread; or takes a sponge of sea sponge and soaks it well with wine, and applies it to that place, because when it reaches the location where the spines and are extracted, it is often removed.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And more often take an eel and soak it well with wine, and cut it into pieces and extract it; or take a porcupine and soak it in water and extract it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	And if those causes are not removed, then use an instrument of the following form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And if it is a small one, and on the outside of it is its cavity, which you can enter into its mouth for convenience.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And if it is raised up in the air, and you guard yourself from the touch of its bones of the neck, so that it does not engage with you or the spike, or what that doctor puts on his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But if the patient allows that entry, by his knowledge of the location of the adjacent cause and puts it down, and pulls his hand with the instrument in it, all this according to the quantity that is prepared for him before he gets tired.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of blood attached to the gallbladder.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the gallbladder blood is treated with what we have said in the division of the cure and not with comfort, consider it in the gallbladder of the patient at sunrise, because you have understood the tongue of it with the instrument that you have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	If you see blood, remove it from that place using a small needle or thin instrument carefully.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible to remove that, then take a concave canula and insert it into the wound of the patient, place an ignited iron in the hollow of the canula, and do this as many times (until the blood stops flowing and stays out of the wound) and keep the patient away from all water for the whole day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a full wet cloth and wipe the mouth of the patient with that, and wash the mouth with that; do not let any cause stick to it, and leave the water on for an hour, then another servant will hold their hand, as the blood seems like water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	And if the recommendation is not followed, then smoke the patient with chamomile or asafetida using the instrument that was recommended for smoking in the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so in four days.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And another way of performing this operation is that you take a hot iron in which there are coals ignited and the iron should be covered with a cloth at one end of which there is a tube, and it should be inserted into that tube the extremity of the instrument; and then lift the subfumigation; and place the patient's mouth on the end of the canula, and close their mouth so that the subfumigation is not lost until you know that the subfumigation has reached the bloodstream, because the bloodstream quickly cools.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it is not effective, then repeat the subfumigation after some time, and prevent the patient from drinking, eating salted and other foods, and not drinking water, and if necessary this regimen should be discontinued.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which blood is drawn from the vein when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps sometimes, but it has some curvature in it.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	The one who should be at the head of the patient, and the end of it resembles the beak of a heron, which is curved, in which there is a roughness of lime, so that when something is understood, it does not leave.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the speech on the recognition and cutting of abscesses.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are special swellings, of various kinds, according to the memory of them, one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz. And the second method is for the places where the abscesses occur in the body, such as the abscess on the head is different from the abscess on the buttocks; and the abscess in the fleshy part is different from the abscess at the joint; and each of them has its own incision for operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	Moreover, some abscesses that are not to be pierced until their maturation is approaching or completion of them.

Other abscesses that should be pierced when they are ready, and not before their maturation is complete, such as abscesses that are near joints, when an abscess approaches a joint, the cause of which is in its vicinity, and often corrodes the ligaments or nerves of that joint, causing contraction of that member; or it is an abscess near a major member, and if you delay piercing it until it is matured, it will spread to the major member; or it is near the anus, so pierce it before it is matured; and do not pierce it until it is completely ready for discharge, but only the one that is near the anus, so that it does not cause discharge from the abscess and is extended to the parts of the anus, and is made a fistula, or that it is made in the term of the abscess that is not healed.

E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre. Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	So you were told that there was no incision or bleeding, and the wind was still causing the pain, and it was cured before the fever passed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And the servant did not do anything if she did not feel well in her stomach, and then she returned to her usual dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	Now I say that there is no fear in the section of the epidural.

De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	About the incision on the abscess that occurs in the groin and is called a hernia of the groin.

Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the separation of the types of gout.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of the different types of gout, I have already mentioned all their kinds in the division.

Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Then you say that an opening is a heat and fever and severe pain that enters before the boil is suppressed; and it is a putrefaction that ceases when the fever, pain, and heat stop.

ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node. Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter of the abscess that occurs due to twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Such as the abscess that occurs in the joint and vein, and similarly, the abscess that occurs in the nerves when it occurs due to their impact or excessive work, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is done in the most common places of the helpers or the ankle, or in any place where there are many joints.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And if the abscess is large and resembles the color of the other body, and it is in the major parts of the patient, and when it is stretched by violence, the patient feels a similar shock.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And if the abscess is not attached to the front of the body, and for this reason it is left alone, and it is blackened throughout and does not go to any part or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, those that are in the joints should not be pierced with iron, because it would likely cause contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But those that are in the head or on the forehead should be lanced with a needle.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if the abscess is small, then use a forceps and cut off that part.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then hang it with an inch of thread, and scrape that part, and remove it; and place the wound on a bandage, and cure it within so that it is healed.

De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	About the incision of an abscess that occurs in the mouth and also occurs in the belly.

When some men have moles in their bellies and other parts of the body, which are called fungal because they resemble those that grow on the heads of certain people, the reason for this is subtle; the head of those who have them is large; and the lips of those who have them are already converted, and they are of those who are small, and they are of those who are very magnificent.

E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of those were turned inwards and were inflamed, and moisture ran from that time on.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I inserted those and again in one foot, 18 unciae deep, and the other 6 unciae deep.

And the operation at the insertion of theirs is that you consider whether the patient is humid, and the color of the skin is white, humid, of subtle reason; then you insert it with a narrow spatula, and in your presence cauterize it in the fire, because more fungal growths are expelled by the section of it; and if you find the section, cauterize that.

Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the cure of hernia at the umbilicus.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Hernia at the umbilicus is caused by various reasons; either by a fissure in the abdominal wall, through which the intestine or hernia comes out; or by a swelling that blocks the blood vessel or artery, as it is called; or by constipation.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If it is by a fissure in the abdominal wall and the intestine comes out through the tear in the skin, then the color of the abscess is similar to that of the body; and the pain is severe, and appears in different positions.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is by the protrusion of the intestine, then the position of that is like that which we have mentioned before, with greater diversity, and when you press that with your fingers, it disappears, and returns; and very often it is in the same place, and is a great sign of the need to introduce baths and hard work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	If it is by moisture, then the pain is severe and does not disappear when you press your hand on it, nor is it tightened or swollen.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is for pus, then apply these signs to the wound to make it disappear or decline.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is for meat, then the pus is heavy, large and hard, and it forms in a certain amount.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is for humidity, then the touch of it is like a lion.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in it is that you consider whether the elevation of the navel is due to swelling from pus, or from a vein, or from humidity; therefore, it should be prohibited from treatment, because in that case there is fear and panic as you were taught in the chapter where he mentioned the abscesses from pus and from veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the elevation of the navel is due to the intestine or the hernia, then command the patient to hold their own belly, and be standing extended; and apply a tent around the entire umbilicus, and command that it be held between your hands on top of the belly, and wrap the space wide around the umbilicus over the place you have properly placed the tent; and extend the mat of the abscess to the parts above the ankle; and apply a strong or weak bandage and the manner of tying the bandage.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then approach the edge of the abscess that has spread over the skin and insert the said needle into that place and try to puncture the intestine; if you have not done so before or do not do it through the skin, then you extract the pus and push the intestine to the parts inside the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the intestine, then take that thread and insert it into those parts and remove the excess of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is against your surgical skill or vein, then circle that thread, and return to your operation; and take two needles and insert them strongly in those two places and insert two needles around the abscess in a crisscross pattern, which you make penetrate; and then strengthen the abscess in four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you want, remove the needles and let the wound close on its own until it heals; or insert that which is thin and can drain, and then cure that which covers the wound with a poultice that will help it to heal.

And if the abdominal prominence is made of flesh and no matter in it or by moisture, then cover the abscess with what we have said and remove the pus or the moisture, which you find in it, and then care for that wound with what you have and what will heal it.

E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit. And then prepare the patient for the operation in which they are located, and prohibit them from eating any food that could cause a reason for their operation. And then examine every part of the body thoroughly until no cause is found for their operation.

And let the blood run, and do not stop it again, and expose the wounds, and clean the blood completely with your hand or with an instrument that is possible among the instruments.

But if you have contrary wounds of large blood in the beginning of the vein or artery, then cauterize it before the flow of blood stops, and then care for it with the other cure until it is healed.

De curacio de ydropici.	Of the cure of hydrocele.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas. E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not make your section over the side on which you want to place the patient, so that the excess does not flow to that place.

And then pierce the instrument through the entire incision, and insert it into that section, and elevate your hand between the codex and the spatula, and you excise that; and if the quantity of one finger or so.

e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	And it is similar to a silver needle; it is made of silver or of fine iron, to which at the lowest part of it there is a small hole, and on its sides three holes: two from one side and one from the other side; and it is shaped at its end by the method of the pen, as follows:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the end of it there is a ring, which when the instrument reaches the water, you should immediately remove from the instrument, and then evacuate the water in small quantities, because if you evacuate too much at once, it may cause great harm to the patient due to the resolution of their spirit animal, or accidents occur to them.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	And then evacuate the water according to the quantity of its virtue and according to what means to you the dispositions of the patient's body, the virtue of their foot, and their goodness.

And then repeat the instrument on the other side if the patient tolerates it, and remove a small amount of liquid, and do this for several days to prevent fear, and be careful not to let too much liquid out.

However, if you are afraid of the patient and let out a large amount of liquid, then cure that part with sand burial, and apply a moist cloth on it, and expose it to sunlight for a long time; and cure that part with desiccative medicines until it is healed.

De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	About the treatment of children who were born without a normal urinary opening.

And in those in which the straight one is not in its place, it leads to, the cause of which is that from those, the one that is born and the straight one is pushed by the end of the head of the child so that it cannot urinate at the parts below, until the child raises the child above; and it is not at birth, because then the sperm cannot reach the mother correctly, and it is a malady due to lack.

The method of the operation is that the patient should lie on their back, and then extend the head of the knife towards the left hand of the operator with great forceful extraction, and insert the tip of the knife into the second part of the intestine, as if it were the point of a pen, so that none of the parts are cut, so that the intestine comes out like the knife and falls into the second part of the intestine after the operation.

Capitol .lvi.	Chapter 66.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	About the blister that occurs in the foreskin at the head of the penis and from corrosion and blackness and adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis.

No-malignant, cover that you hang with a thin thread and cut the one that is inside that one; then place it over the part that is submerged in Egyptian salve; and then apply that, cure the wound with the salve until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the wound is malignant, of a blackish color, then cover that which you administer with a pointed cautery at the beginning and end of it.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the wound is on the prepuce of the head of the uncircumcised penis, and one part of the wound is in the prepuce and the other part is deformed, then cover that which is inside the prepuce until it is consolidated; and then cure that deformity, for when you cure it along with the prepuce, it is not guaranteed that it will not be three-sided.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And if there have been accidents in the genitals and in the black and curled prepuce, then cover that which is already discolored and which is about to become corrupted or has already been corrupted; and then apply linens over it with honey, which is pounded with flour of millet, and of wheat, and of barley, and of rice.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And then cure that other wound until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if there is bleeding from the wound, then administer a silver nitrate cautery in this manner:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	where the silver nitrate cautery is applied at two points simultaneously, one to stop the bleeding and the other to the wound when it becomes corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is corrupted and destroyed completely in the moment, then you should introduce a catheter into the urethra to allow the patient to urinate through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adherence of the foreskin to the head of the penis (and this adherence does not occur except in those where the foreskin is intact, and it is not required for circumcision; and when adherence occurs due to inflammation or abscess) then you should excise a blunt spatula until the bond is dissolved and the head of the penis is completely released.
