In the reduction of its own dislocation, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is at the parts inside, make sure that the patient lies on their left side; and place your hand on the back in that place where the head of the bed and the place which was left hang down; and extend the bandage from the angle of the bed to the furthest part of the ribcage.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another strong assistant grasps the patient's arms, and lifts the heavy side of the patient's bed, and extends to the parts of the body by forceful extension, so that it returns to its own place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	This is the least painful cure for this member when it is reduced compared to other cases.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is excused from you and you do not obey the entrance of this special cure for all cases, make sure that both of the patient's feet are tied together with a strong bandage on both sides and below.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each should be equal to four fingers, and the patient's bed should be extended higher than the other by a quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And the patient should be suspended over the top of the bed, and in the highest position; and the length of it from the ground should be equal to two arm lengths.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And command a strong young man to traction the head of the cushion, and another young man should suspend it from the patient, and the other young man should pull the cushion with great force, so that the joint returns to its place quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	In the proper reduction, when dislocation occurs at the shoulder joint, place a cushion under the arm according to what we have recommended in the handbook; and strengthen the ligament over the patient's bed properly and on their chest.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And place two boards under their body, one under their feet, and the other under their head; and adjust the boards to the middle of the patient's chest above which they have wrapped warm clothes, so that the patient is not crushed by the board being between the patient's thighs, so that the extension to the parts behind is not pulled.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each assistant extends his part, and the doctor guides his hand according to the art of reduction.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if the patient is overweight, it is quite difficult; otherwise, place your hand carefully and as we have said in the book for that purpose.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	However, make sure the patient does not move his legs too much.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation reaches its parts, then make sure that the cushion is extended more, and follow this method according to the book; and the doctor places the palm of his hand on the patient's groin, and another servant holds it with his other hand, and the one who extends it at the parts should pause at the part of the denol.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation reaches its parts from behind, then do not make the patient extend his legs, and raise him on the ground; having made sure that he is placed on a hard cause, as we have said about the position of the patient between two stools; and it is over his face and the limbs are extended, as we have said, without causing any harm.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it should be administered compression with an ointment on the location where the joint is affected.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore, when the reduction is completed as follows — and the sign of the reduction of which is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend both thighs of the patient, and when you see those equal and the patient extends one thigh and expands the other, then you know that the member according to which is returned — and then you adjust two cushions and press and extend the bent part so that the wide is not swollen in any of the parts; and adhere the patient to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then remove the bandage and press, and compare one cushion with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those equal in the right way, then you know that the dislocation has been stopped, and then let the patient go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any sign of softening, then you return and press that, and extend it according to your first structure, and let it be for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then remove that one, and make him wait in an ambulatory over which you have placed a bed, until he is comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32:
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	About the treatment of dislocation of the thumb.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The thumb is dislocated in three ways: when it is dislocated forward, backward, and to the side; but it is not dislocated downwards.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of thumb dislocation is that you command the patient to place his cushion on the side; then you will know that the thumb is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all three ways of thumb dislocation is that you make the patient lie down straight, unless he can already extend his own arm; then place your hand on his face, and hold his foot between your palms; and then make him hold his thumb against your palms, and bring those fingers together over his thumb for strength, and another servant extends his leg until the thumb returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	When lifting the patient, ensure that their cushion adheres to the surface that is not laborious.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then apply the plaster to that and make the cushion stick to the surface, and leave it there for three or four days, and then remove it.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not use the patient for walking for several days, until they are healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	However, if the reduction of the patient to you is excused, then in the meantime administer strong extension to the membranes of which in the cure of the hand previous narrative.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the cure of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	Sometimes the ankle is dislocated by slight removal, and sometimes it is dislocated after some time, and the dislocation of it is made at the parts within or at the parts without.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the way to deal with the dislocation of it is that sometimes the ankle inflates and proceeds to the part where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	If the cure of removing it is of great difficulty, and it should be extended with ease to the hands and should be equalized within a short time when it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	In the cure of it when it is dislocated secondly, let him do a proper examination of the patient, and have a strong and skilled assistant behind the back of that one in the middle position of him.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you should place your left hand on the most appropriate part of the foot, and your right hand on the part behind the knee in the position of the hollow.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then pull the foot towards your right hand, and place your left hand on both sides of the calf, and extend your left hand; and push the foot against the right side of the thigh three times.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	Do that twice after you have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then push the foot against the left thigh the third time, and you are at the hollow.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore if it returns in one or two times this way, and if you see the foot equalized, it is good; and if not, then repeat the operation on him, until he returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	If it is forbidden for you to reduce the hernia with the method we have recommended, then place the patient on their back on the ground, and firmly hold a pillow under their back, and place a box between their thighs, and you have already covered them with a cloth so that they do not get cold.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And the assistant should hold the patient's limbs, and another assistant should extend their leg or the bandage that is tied around the ankle; and each assistant should extend against the extension of their own side, and the pillow should be extended between the patient's thighs to retain it so that the hernia does not fall to the sides beyond its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the doctor should equalize the dislocation with their hands, and another assistant should hold the healthy limb at the sides, where the dislocation returns to its ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And when the dislocation returns and you declare the patient's health from the reduction of the hernia, then apply a poultice firmly to that area, and tie the leg to the bed.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And if you fear or guard the nerves that are behind the heel, because the bandage over it should not be too tight and it will cause great pain.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave it for two days or three; if the bandage becomes soft, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then remove it on the third day or fourth, and prevent the patient from walking for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is necessary to walk during that time, do not do so until the dislocation is dissolved and corrupted, and then it will not require treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if the abscess bursts, then cover it with the same ointment that we mentioned in our previous story, in another place for treatment and to prevent infection until it is completely healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter thirty-four.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the cure of the aforementioned dislocations of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	And if the one that is dislocated has a similar extension of his toes; and that which is not difficult, in front of the longer.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	If the dislocation is in the acromion process of the shoulder, then have the patient lie on their back, either on the ground or on a table, and remain there as if they were lying down.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then, standing by the patient's foot, place your hand over the area where the joints are, and gently press on that spot until you feel it return to its original position and does not appear in the prominent location.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then, place your hand under the patient's belly on a table that supports the entire body, with two cushions, and strengthen that support in a decent and firm manner for three days; and then remove it and let it rest for several days, until it is strong and assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the special types of dislocation that are caused by injury or fracture or any other means.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those causes occurs and you perform the treatment and restoration of that, many times death follows.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And to avoid presuming on the cure of that person, but rather what is known in the art, of long use, mercy and pity, late, not ardent or presumptuous; and that he uses in the beginning of medicines that yield apostems cautiously, and leave the sick man to divine judgment, unless to that one to whom you hope for salvation from perdition, for relief from misery, and in which some hope appears.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then you should strive to make that person as soon as possible, in the beginning of the cause, giving that it might engender an apostem cautiously.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns after you wish, then administer a regimen that yields an apostem cautiously and heals the sore, and give it what is suitable for it from decoctions of drying herbs.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if dislocation is accompanied by fracture and accidents in the bones that are separated, then you should perforate their surface, and do so as we have said in the simple diseases of that which was previously mentioned in those places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid the second of that tool in the ways of fear according to what my previous preaching preceded you; for that is better for you to your own Creator, and more enduring to your glory, and more salutations to your own way as those in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	May the words of Albucasis be perfectly understood, for which God may not be blessed.
